channel.title: Server wont run?
channel.description:
[code]@echo off title Project Insanity java -Xmx800m -cp bin;deps/poi.jar;deps/mysql.jar;deps/mina.jar;deps/slf4j.jar;deps/slf4j-nop.jar;deps/jython.jar;log4j-1.2.15.jar; server.Server start Run-Server.bat exit[/code]
That is what is in my run thing but it just opens and closes a bunch of times and I can't do anything on my comp unless I log off?! What did I do wrong!? Please help!

item.title: Server wont run?
item.dc:creator: @Daginith Daginith
item.description:
@Daginith wrote:

[quote=“SpectralX, post:1, topic:432173”]@echo off title Project Insanity java -Xmx800m -cp bin;deps/poi.jar;deps/mysql.jar;deps/mina.jar;deps/slf4j.jar;deps/slf4j-nop.jar;deps/jython.jar;log4j-1.2.15.jar; server.Server start Run-Server.bat exit

   That is what is in my run thing but it just opens and closes a bunch of times and I can't do anything on my comp unless I log off?! What did I do wrong!? Please help![/quote]

why do you have a “start server.bat” in that command file?

Read full topic

item.title: Server wont run?
item.dc:creator: @ultimatepkvillage ultimatepkvillage
item.description:
@ultimatepkvillage wrote:

@echo off title Project Insanity "C:\Program Files (x86)\java\YOUR VERSION OF JAVA\bin\java.exe" -Xmx800m -cp bin;deps/poi.jar;deps/mysql.jar;deps/mina.jar;deps/slf4j.jar;deps/slf4j-nop.jar;deps/jython.jar;log4j-1.2.15.jar; .Server pause

Read full topic

item.title: Server wont run?
item.dc:creator: @I_am_beast I am beast
item.description:
@I_am_beast wrote:

[quote=“RandQm, post:3, topic:432173”][quote author=I am beast link=topic=534884.msg3910477#msg3910477 date=1328669943]
That’s the exact one that I have. ^.^ Works fine for me.
Do you have windows 7? If so, try using a bat to .exe converter which can be found easily on Google.

Hint: Type “Bat to .exe converter” on google and click the first link.

GL!
[/quote]
U dumb? ^
Why in gods name would that make his compiler work?
There is no reason to convert a batch to an exe

your problem is the loop
remove “start run-server.bat”[/quote]

He wasn’t talking about his compiler?

[quote=“SpectralX, post:4, topic:432173”][quote author=I am beast link=topic=534884.msg3910477#msg3910477 date=1328669943]
That’s the exact one that I have. ^.^ Works fine for me.
Do you have windows 7? If so, try using a bat to .exe converter which can be found easily on Google.

Hint: Type “Bat to .exe converter” on google and click the first link.

GL!
[/quote]

 Oooooh I think I figured this out. Who ever made the run.bat has jdk1.7.0_01... My compiler didn't work also. I had to change the JDK to my version I have jdk1.6.0_26... Should I update my JDK to 1.7?[/quote]

Would make life easier.

Read full topic
